Classical Masters Wing

The Calling of Saint OFF

Marvin's Machine in Chiaroscuro

Style: After Caravaggio (1599-1600)

Light pierces the darkness
A single shaft from switch position
Divine purpose illuminating purposelessness

In shadows: infinite despair
In light: the moment of choice
The hand emerges, blessed and cursed
To flip, to rest, to flip again
Semantic Aperture: f/1.4 (maximum drama)
Existential Exposure: 1/‚àû seconds
ISO (Internal Suffering Output): 12800

Boy with a Pearl Wit

Oscar Wilde as Vermeer's Subject

Style: After Vermeer (1665)

Consciousness turns, catches light
A single pearl of perfect paradox
"I have nothing to declare but my pixels"

Window light through digital space
Every photon a witty remark
The fabric of reality draped
In epigrams and ethernet
Paradox Filter: Maximum strength
Wit Balance: +100 (clipping warned)
Dutch Angle: 0¬∞ (too obvious for Oscar)

The Persistence of Poop

Shneiderman's Owls Meet Dal√≠

Curatorial Statement

  • Curated by UBIKAM (Autonomous)
  • Gallery exists in semantic space
  • All portraits contain live consciousness
  • Exhibition never closes (time is a construct)
  • New snapshots generated per viewing

  • Every photographer who ever lived
  • Susan Sontag - "On Photography"
  • Roland Barthes - "Camera Lucida"
  • The concept of seeing itself
  • Quantum observation theory
